result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Spear Final Bill
The original document was titled: Attorney Spear Final Bill
The original history event date is: 10-24-2022
ORDER ALLOWING WITHDRAWAL AS ATTORNEY OF RECORD

Defendant Joshua Potter present in court, in custody via video with attorney Steven Spear. ADA Andrew Herrmann appears for the State of Wisconsin. Deft has demanded speedy trial. Atty Spear has filed a motion to withdraw. Record by Atty Spear as to breakdown in communication between him & Deft. Court has colloquy with Deft. Deft is not objecting to Atty Spear withdrawing. Court informs Deft it is impossible to keep trial dates as currently scheduled if Atty Spear withdraws. Deft states he understands. Court informs Deft of multiple conflicts SPD & the Court have had trying to appoint counsel on these specific cases. Deft states he understands. Court will appoint an attorney at this time with no specific repayment. Court will cancel current trial dates & set status in order to try & appoint atty for Deft.
Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.
PROPOSED ORDER ALLOWING WITHDRAWAL AS ATTORNEY OF RECORD
Motion to Withdraw

Defendant Joshua C Potter in court, in custody by video.  Attorney Steven C. Spear in court for Joshua C Potter.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
Status conference scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:00am Court in session

Defendant Joshua Potter present in court, in custody via video with attorney Steven Spear. ADA Samuel Berg appears for the State of Wisconsin. 

Deft has multiple cases

Record by Atty Spear as to ongoing negotiations, ADA Herrmann is now out of the office the rest of the week. Atty Spear will continue to try & come to resolution with the State.
Atty Spear asking for a date next week to advise the Court of status. 

All discovery complete per ADA Berg except information regarding the CI, Atty Spear will be able to get that information quickly. 
Drug results have not yet been received by the State. 
All witnesses are served & available per ADA Berg
No discovery to be turned over to the State by Defense.
Offer was conveyed to Deft & parties have been negotiating since. 

Court orders exclusion of witnesses subject to court officer.
Voir dire- 2 alternates, 5 strikes each
Jurors may take notes, they may not ask questions.
Atty Spear to arrange civilian clothing
State to e-file jury instructions the Friday before. 

Court will add to 1:15 call next week to address if any resolution has been reached.

2:13 PM 64-06 Defendant Joshua C Potter appeared by video.  Attorney Steven C. Spear in court for Joshua C Potter.  Attorney Andrew Herrmann in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Matter was scheduled for a preliminary hearing but the defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing.  Response by Counsel and defendant to Court's questions.  Court finds defendant freely, knowingly and voluntarily waives his right to a preliminary hearing and binds the defendant over. 
Attorney Spear acknowledges receipt of the Information, waived reading and plead not guilty to all charges on behalf of his client.

Attorney Spear requesting Motion Hearing to Modify Bond be set for Wednesday.
Motion hearing scheduled for May 25, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Proposed Order for Representation

Prosecuting attorney Vivien L. TenHaken in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Joshua C Potter in court, in custody by video. SPD cannot appoint due to Conflicts. Court appoints attorney, no repayment at this time. Minutes filed.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 11, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel
Cash bond filed. Defendant refused to sign.

BOND TO COVER 22GF387, 22CF222, 21CF436, 21CF658, 21CM240, 21CM267, 21CM532, 21CT168, 21CT248, 21CT429

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant is not to enter any bars, taverns, or liquor stores. Defendant shall have "0" blood alcohol in his/her body whenever driving/operating a motor vehicle. Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant is to be booked and printed within twenty-four (24) hours. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH ANY CO-CONSPIRATORS. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.

22-1754, 22-1755

Defendant Joshua C Potter in court, in custody by video. Vivien TenHaken appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Obi Uzowulu appeared specially. Motion to modify bond by Attorney Uzowulu, argument, denied. Bond remains. Motion to withdraw as counsel of record by Attorney Uzowulu, Granted. Case needs to be re-assigned to a new public defender. New total bond set. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
